channel.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
channel.description:
[url]https://www.cry-of-fear.com/forum/index.php?topic=354.0[/url] [quote] Well, what can we say? The response to the FB "like" campaign we posted just over 6 weeks ago has been absolutely astonishing to say the least. The amount of cooperation and support shown by the community has been absolutely mindblowing, so from myself and the rest of the Cry of Fear team we'd like to say thank you. Not only have we kept our promise to reveal the release date after we reached the 5000 likes, but we'd also like to tell you that we've made, and finished, an entire extra campaign to thank you guys. You can actually see a tiny, tiny snippet of it hidden in the trailer we released just recently.
So, thank you all! Special thanks go to Pewdiepie and Spike and Barley for rallying their fans to our cause. Check out their Youtube channels and support them! [/quote] 22.02.2012
Definetly going to try it. Discuss.

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Bumpin’ da thread to tell ya guys.
Patch 1.1 and 1.2 is out.
Also, CoF SDK.

item.description:
I think it just might be the textures themselves. I noticed some of them are quite good, and some aren’t so good - to the point where some of the bump mapping seems pointless on such a low-res texture.

item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
k3nny1550:

What I do find annoying is that dual wielding the cellphone and the Glock puts the gun in his left hand. Wouldn’t it be the other way around so the most coordinated hand is using the gun?

You’re assuming the protagonist is right handed. I suppose since he uses the gun in his right hand without dual wielding you’d think that though… Maybe he’s ambidextrous .

Edit: My game doesn’t seem to look as good as the screenshots on the Moddb page. Seems like the textures are too low resolution, though maybe that has to do with the resolution I’m running at? Anyone else feel this way?

Read full topic
item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
That bothered me too. Also, hitting reload when you are dual wielding with a gun and the phone and it just won’t let you reload unless you put the phone away… just do that automatically. A phone is not very big.

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Yeah, I understand that it makes it like film and some people like it, but I just always found it annoying personally. Though I suppose for a sp game I can deal with some, but I had to lower it as a lot of the game is dark so at the default level it was a bit to prominent for my taste.

Read full topic
item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I turn down the film grain a bit in games like Left 4 Dead when I need to save on processing power and recognize threats more readily. But in a single player game like Cry of Fear it has a very cinema-like effect on the visuals and lends the game some style. After all, have you ever tried shooting any kind of video footage in low key light? It’s grainy as fuck. But yeah, good thinking on the devs to have options to allow people to turn that off if they so please.

Read full topic
item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I personally can’t stand film grain unless it’s so little it’s barely noticeable. Thank god you can turn it down in the options.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Ry_amp_955_n
item.description:
^hehe i chuckled. Someone tried doing a PARANOIA source remake as well. fuckin trolls.

but speakign of Paranoia, if you enjoyed Cry of Fear, i would play that one too even tho CoF is graphically more enhanced and of higher quality. Para still looks good tho.

Link to moddb Paranoia page: https://www.moddb.com/mods/paranoia (watch the two vids. i especially enjoyed this mods release trailer.)

item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Liuk
item.description:
Oh fucking jesus. These monsters are truely horrifying. [Spoilers]
[COLOR=‘Black’]When I saw the floating grudge thing in the basement, I shit 90,000 bricks. Also, the part after you put in the code to unlock the door, and you hear a chainsaw starting up, and about 50 different hallways = HOLYFUCKINGSHITRUNRUNWTFBBQ!
[Spoilers]

Definitely a very well done mod. I’m very impressed, especially for this being on the gold source engine. Although being scary, I’m sure I will thoroughly enjoy the campaign, and maybe eventually the coop. Not having played many mods this year, and probably won’t play very many others, I think this is easily my MOTY.

Read full topic
item.source: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
Ryλn:

It tells you to use light source, you go through a couple of doors, kill a nigger holding a hammer with your knife in a small doorway, then find a tape recorder on the ground. OR instead of being a curious fag and asking questions, you could watch a video to see when the save point comes up.

and not just any video, but an entertaining “let’s play” of Cry of Fear by a viking badass: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JsZ_fL4RCtE

The reason I didn’t watch a video is because I don’t really want spoilers. I just wanted to know if it’s worth trying to play it again or not, given that if the next save point was to be in 1 hour then it’s likely to crash a gazillion times before that ever happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
Guys, the game runs, but it freezes when I do certain things (mostly when opening the inventory) at which point I have to quit it. It’s been like the 4th time I’ve watched the intro and played up until the part where I get the suggestion of using the phone as a light source. However, I don’t really want to endlessly play the same part over and over without actually knowing when the next save point will be. Can someone give me a clue as to how far the first save point is?

Read full topic

item.title: Cry of Fear - Release Date announced
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
Jesus fuck. It drags quite a bit at the part with the fuses, but picks up rapidly once you escape on the train. The forest afterwards… that was perfect. You walk into a field and find a lantern as the only light source in pitch darkness. you walk over to the lantern and from somewhere in the darkness THERES A MOTHERFUCKING CHAINSAW AND INTENSE CHASE MUSIC HOLY SHIT HOLY SHIT WHAT DO I DO
